programme.desc: Cunning Hannibal Lecter resurfaces after a decade in hiding to toy with FBI agent Clarice Starling. As Starling's career flounders, Lecter attempts to elude a greedy Italian police detective. Meanwhile, a maimed former victim of Lecter's plots revenge. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Aliens
programme.desc: Ripley awakens 57 years later in this sequel to 1979's "Alien," returning to the space colony where she first encountered a hideous, reptilian creature. The film won Oscars for Sound and Visual Effects. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Amelia's Closet
programme.desc: When pushed to the edge by the bullies in her class, 11-year-old Amelia retaliates by secretly stealing from her classmates and hiding the items in the back of her closet. Winner of the Short Film Competition at the 2017 American Black Film Festival. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Cleopatra
programme.desc: Epic about Egypt's legendary queen and her liaisons with Julius Caesar and Mark Antony during the heyday of the Roman Empire. (cc).

programme.title: It's Me, Hilary The Man Who Drew Eloise
programme.desc: A profile of illustrator Hilary Knight, who collaborated on the "Eloise" children's books with author Kay Thompson, features home movies and interviews with fans of his animation, including executive producer Lena Dunham, Mindy Kaling and Fran Lebowitz. (cc).

programme.title: You've Got Mail
programme.desc: The owner of a bookstore chain falls for a competitor he meets in an online chat room, unaware she owns a Manhattan shop he's trying to put out of business. Although their online personas get along wonderfully, sparks fly when they meet in person. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Robin Williams Come Inside My Mind
programme.desc: This documentary aims to unpack the mystery of the late Robin Williams' comedic genius. By drawing from interviews with Williams, his contemporaries, and his son Zak Williams, it provides insight into his creative process, his battle with drug use and alcoholism, and his remarkably successful career as an entertainer. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: A team of high-class thieves set out to avenge their mentor's death with the help of his daughter. The plan consists of them stealing a fortune in gold, having it pilfered from them and then trying to get it back. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Table 19
programme.desc: An irritable wedding guest is stuck at a table of losers at the reception. But when she and her tablemates realize they've been seated in the back due to their hosts' disdain, they vow to ignore the snub and follow their party dreams instead. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Avatar
programme.desc: In this sci-fi epic, a paraplegic war veteran named Jake Sully volunteers for a mission on the planet Pandora, a hostile environment where human beings can only survive by remotely controlling alien avatars. However, Jake soon realizes that the Na'vi, a race of creatures native to Pandora, are being threatened by his own people, and he decides to join them in fighting back against mankind. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: When 400,000 British and Allied troops end up trapped on the beaches of Dunkirk, France, following a catastrophic defeat during WWII, a number of civilian boats set out to rescue them before they are decimated by the approaching Nazi forces. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Italian Job
programme.desc: A team of high-class thieves set out to avenge their mentor's death with the help of his daughter. The plan consists of them stealing a fortune in gold, having it pilfered from them and then trying to get it back. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Kill the Messenger
programme.desc: A reporter investigates a possible link between the CIA and the importing of cocaine into the U.S. in the 1980s. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: American Splendor
programme.desc: Well-acted, wildly original biopic about surly Harvey Pekar (Paul Giamatti), whose comic books on the banality of life developed a cult following. The film mixes real-life clips and animation with the narrative. Hope Davis. Pekar appears as himself, playing "Real Harvey." Donal Logue and Molly Shannon have cameos as stage actors. Shari Springer Berman and Robert Pulcini co-directed. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Seabiscuit
programme.desc: A depression-era sports drama about the legendary racehorse, Seabiscuit, and the three men who saw him to victory. Together, the three work to help the famed horse to several symbolic victories that helped to inspire a downtrodden 1930s America. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Everything, Everything
programme.desc: A teenage girl is unable to leave her home because she has an immunodeficiency that makes her allergic to almost everything. However, her life changes for the better when she begins to communicate with the boy next door, and their relationship eventually inspires her to venture into the outside world. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Theory of Everything
programme.desc: This biopic of celebrated physicist Stephen Hawking explores his early years at Cambridge, where he fell in love with liberal-arts student and future wife Jane shortly before being diagnosed with ALS. As the years progress, Jane begins to feel more like a nurse than a spouse, and Hawking develops feelings for a woman who is hired to care for him. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Away We Go
programme.desc: A thirtysomething couple (John Krasinski and Maya Rudolph) expecting their first child set off on a cross-country search for the perfect place to live. After learning that his parents are moving to Europe, the duo realize that they can lay down roots anywhere. They visit a number of old friends in different cities and learn valuable lessons about parenting. Directed by Sam Mendes. Maggie Gyllenhaal, Allison Janney, Jeff Daniels. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Dragonfly
programme.desc: After his wife dies in an accident, a doctor (Kevin Costner) wonders if she is trying to contact him from beyond the grave. Kathy Bates, Joe Morton, Ron Rifkin, Linda Hunt, Susanna Thompson, Jacob Vargas. Directed by Tom Shadyac. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Frequently Asked Questions About Time Travel
programme.desc: A trio of nerdy Londoners stumble into a series of time-traveling adventures with apocalyptic implications thanks to a woman from the future and a portal in the men's bathroom. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: A Sound of Thunder
programme.desc: A time-travel expedition to hunt dinosaurs results in a disastrous alteration of history. Shoddy adaptation of Ray Bradbury's classic short story. Edward Burns, Catherine McCormack, Ben Kingsley, Jemima Rooper. Directed by Peter Hyams. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: The Butterfly Effect 3 Revelations
programme.desc: A young man with the ability to travel back and forth in time unwittingly unleashes a serial killer when he tries to solve the mystery of his high-school girlfriend's death. Chris Carmack, Rachel Miner, Melissa Jones, Sonya A. Avakian. Directed by Seth Grossman. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Back to the Future
programme.desc: An eccentric scientist builds a time machine, which accidentally transports a high-school student back to the 1950s, where the teen inadvertently interferes with the budding romance between his future parents. The boy must figure out how to set things right, or risk completely altering the future. (repeat) (cc).

programme.title: Liar Liar
programme.desc: Jim Carrey's comic timing is impressive in this comedy about a slick, overachieving lawyer who's forced to tell the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth. Jennifer Tilly. Audrey: Maura Tierney. Dana: Swoosie Kurtz. Miranda: Amanda Donohoe. Directed by Tom Shadyac. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Observe and Report
programme.desc: A mentally unstable mall cop competes with a seasoned detective to catch an elusive flasher in this dark comedy starring Seth Rogen. A creep is flashing his goods at Forest Ridge Mall, and Ronnie Barnhardt (Rogen) is on the case. Meanwhile, as Ronnie attempts to earn a spot at the police academy and impress pretty makeup-counter girl Brandi (Anna Faris), scheming Detective Harrison (Ray Liotta) does his best to humiliate the put-upon rent-a-cop with a series of cruel pranks. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Whip It
programme.desc: Drew Barrymore makes her directorial debut with this quirky sports drama about an ex-beauty queen (Ellen Page) who gives up her tiara for roller derby, to the dismay of her mother (Marcia Gay Harden). Kristen Wiig, Juliette Lewis. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Silence of the Lambs
programme.desc: Best Picture winner about an FBI trainee (Best Actress Jodie Foster), who has a knack for analyzing serial killers, and enlists the aid of an imprisoned, cannibalistic sociopath (Best Actor Anthony Hopkins) in tracking a sadistic murderer. An Oscar went to director Jonathan Demme and also Ted Tally won for Best Adapted Screenplay for his script based on the Thomas Harris novel. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: Jumpy thriller about an unhinged Gulf War vet (Michael Shannon) who infects an Oklahoma waitress (Ashley Judd) with his paranoid delusions involving invasive insects and clandestine military experiments. Directed by William Friedkin and written by Tracy Letts, who adapted his stage play. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Doctor
programme.desc: A fact-based story of a surgeon who learns the importance of compassion in a physician-patient relationship when he's treated for cancer. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Paparazzi
programme.desc: After an aggressive photographer causes his family injury, a hot action star (Cole Hauser) vows revenge. Clichéd and mean-spirited. Robin Tunney, Dennis Farina. Mel Gibson has a cameo in the film, which was made by his production company. Paul Abascal directed. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: John McCain For Whom the Bell Tolls
programme.desc: A profile Sen. John McCain (R-Ariz.) focuses on his years in a POW camp during the Vietnam War; his three decades in Congress; and his late in life battle with cancer. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Sideways
programme.desc: Miles and Jack take a trip to California's wine country the week before Jack gets married. While Miles wants to turn Jack on to the art of wine tasting, Jack longs to exploit his last days as a bachelor when they encounter two fascinating women. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Battle of the Sexes
programme.desc: This sports docudrama recreates the legendary 1973 "Battle of the Sexes" tennis match between Billie Jean King and Bobby Riggs. When Riggs brags that he can beat any woman in the world on the tennis court, reigning champion King accepts his challenge. Their highly publicized match soon takes on a larger meaning as a milestone in the fight for gender equality. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: The romantic adventures of a fashionable New York City writer and her three chic friends continue in this movie adaptation of the popular HBO series. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Beguiled
programme.desc: In this Civil War drama, a deserter from the Union Army seeks refuge at an all-female boarding school in Virginia, where the ladies compete for his affections while tending to his injuries. His presence at the school slowly poisons the relationships between the various women, who eventually turn on the soldier. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Gifted
programme.desc: A bachelor named Frank tries his best to raise his 7-year-old niece Mary in rural Florida. But when it's revealed that Mary is a budding math prodigy, Frank gets into a custody battle with his mother over what's best for her future. (repeat) (cc).(n)

programme.title: Weekend at Bernie's
programme.desc: A boss invites two underlings to his beach house with the intention of having them killed because they uncovered his illegal activities. However, when they arrive and discover the boss himself is dead, the pair spends the weekend pretending he's alive so that they can enjoy the place and figure out how to get themselves out of harm's way. (cc).

programme.title: Pirate Radio
programme.desc: After the BBC bans rock and roll from Britain's official airwaves, a DJ (Bill Nighy) begins broadcasting from a boat sailing in international waters. He and a group of on-air personalities become very popular, but the government wants to shut them down. Directed by Richard Curtis. Philip Seymour Hoffman, Rhys Ifans, Kenneth Branagh. (cc).

programme.title: Outcast
programme.desc: In the Season 2 premiere, Kyle and Amber return to Rome; Rev. Anderson struggles to comfort Patricia, knowing he may have inadvertently been complicit in her son's death; Sidney disappears; and Byron determines to keep the state police from investigating the arson attack. (cc).

programme.title: King Arthur Legend of the Sword
programme.desc: Arthur draws the legendary sword Excalibur from the stone, and must learn to harness its power in order to lead a rebellion against his uncle Vortigern, who murdered Arthur's father and usurped the throne years ago. (cc).

programme.title: Annie Hall
programme.desc: Woody Allen cowrote and directed this Best Picture, and stars as a neurotic Jewish comedian and writer recounting the roller-coaster relationship he had with a kooky, WASPish aspiring singer. The film employs fantasy flashbacks, direct-to-camera monologues, subtitles and even a cartoon sequence to tell its tale. (cc).

programme.title: Jupiter Ascending
programme.desc: In this sci-fi epic in which human beings are the least-evolved species in the known universe, an ex-soldier protects a seemingly ordinary woman who's been targeted for assassination by a ruthless queen. (cc).

programme.title: Hidden Figures
programme.desc: Three female African-American mathematicians provide crucial calculations for NASA's space race against the Soviets, all while dealing with the racist and sexist assumptions of their white co-workers. (cc).

programme.title: The Great Wall
programme.desc: In 11th-century China, two mercenaries from the West are captured by a military organization that are headquartered in a fortress on the Great Wall. In time, the duo get caught up in a battle between the Chinese warriors and a supernatural menace that the Great Wall was built to repel. (cc).

programme.title: Stratton
programme.desc: A British Special Boat Service operative named John Stratton is tasked with infiltrating an Iranian facility that contains biochemical weapons. Later, Stratton pursues a former Soviet spy who is planning a terrorist attack in London. (cc).

programme.title: Percy Jackson & the Olympians The Lightning Thief
programme.desc: Accident-prone teenager Percy discovers he's actually a demigod, the son of Poseidon, and he must master his newfound skills and find Zeus' stolen lightning in order to prevent a war between the Greek gods that could devastate the entire world. (cc).

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a boy named Jake follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities, and learns he is destined to protect them. (cc).

programme.title: Love Happens
programme.desc: A widower (Aaron Eckhart) develops feelings for a student (Jennifer Aniston) and is forced to come to terms with his wife's death. John Carroll Lynch, Martin Sheen. (cc).

programme.title: The War of the Roses
programme.desc: This dark comedy follows the disintegration of a marriage, from happy first date to domestic discontent to a truly hellish divorce. (cc).

programme.title: The Ref
programme.desc: When a cat burglar is ditched by his partner in the middle of a break-in, he takes a bickering Connecticut couple hostage. Seeking to get out of the situation alive, and out of handcuffs, the burglar acts as referee to sort out their family problems. (cc).

programme.title: Four Christmases
programme.desc: When their annual vacation getaway falls through, a happily unmarried couple are forced to spend Christmas with the families of their four divorced parents on the same day. (cc).

programme.title: Almost Christmas
programme.desc: An African-American widower asks his family to join him for their first Christmas since his wife passed away. However, having all of them under one roof leads to a number of personal confrontations as secrets are revealed and marriages are tested. (cc).

programme.title: Couples Retreat
programme.desc: A couple attempts to salvage their marriage by inviting three other couples to join them at an island resort. However, everyone is disturbed to discover that participation in therapy sessions is mandatory if they hope to remain at the idyllic paradise. (cc).

programme.title: Manhattan
programme.desc: Peter Minuit is a bored millionaire who masquerades as a safecracker. He falls in with a gang of thugs from Hell's Kitchen and saves a young woman and her brother from becoming criminals. Peter battles gang kingpin Bud McGinnis in a showdown over the fate of the two would-be crooks. (cc).

programme.title: Like.Share.Follow
programme.desc: An Internet sensation finds himself stalked by an obsessive ''super-fan'' who will stop at nothing to get close to him. (cc).

programme.title: October Sky
programme.desc: Before becoming a NASA engineer, Homer Hickam was a curious high-school student from West Virginia. When the Soviet Russia launched the first man-made satellite, Sputnik, in 1957, Homer and his friends began designing their own rockets with dreams of escaping their coal-mining town. (cc).

programme.title: The Losers
programme.desc: A team of mercenaries wage war on the CIA after they're double-crossed by rogue agent Max (Jason Patric) during a mission in the Bolivian jungle. But in order to get to Max, the team will need a little help from sexy operative Aisha (Zoe Saldana), who has her own reasons for joining the fight. (cc).

programme.title: Love Potion No. 9
programme.desc: Two nerdy scientists become irresistible after drinking a palm reader's secret formula. (cc).

programme.title: Murder by Numbers
programme.desc: Two young boys execute the "perfect" murder, even pinning it on a local crook, but a detective with a disturbed past will not be outsmarted. The boys lie about knowing each other and cover their tracks, but a lack of trust could bring them down. (cc).

programme.title: Speed
programme.desc: A bomber has rigged a bus with a bomb and a cop must get on-board while it is traveling to figure out how to get the passengers off. (cc).

programme.title: Once upon a Time in Mexico
programme.desc: A corrupt CIA agent teams up with a guitar-playing gunslinger to stop a coup South of the Border. (cc).

programme.title: From Within
programme.desc: A young Christian named Lindsay (Elizabeth Rice) finds her faith shaken when her small town is beset by a rash of gruesome suicides. (cc).

programme.title: Totem
programme.desc: A teen goes to extremes to shield her family from a supernatural menace. (cc).

programme.title: The Fate of the Furious
programme.desc: In the eighth installment of the "Fast and the Furious" series, Dominic Toretto's crew are rocked to their core when they must face their most-dangerous adversary yet: Dom himself, who is now working with a shadowy cyber-terrorist known only as Cipher. As DSS agent Luke Hobbs and the rest of the team attempt to fight back, they find themselves in an alliance with their old enemy, assassin Deckard Shaw. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Pelican Brief
programme.desc: A law student is forced to go on the run after she uncovers an assassination plot based on a trail of murdered judges, a revelation which puts her own life in jeopardy. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Outcast
programme.desc: In the Season 2 premiere, Kyle and Amber return to Rome; Rev. Anderson struggles to comfort Patricia, knowing he may have inadvertently been complicit in her son's death; Sidney disappears; and Byron determines to keep the state police from investigating the arson attack. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Statement
programme.desc: High-minded but muddled thriller about a former Nazi collaborator (Michael Caine) trying to avoid capture by the French government and death by vengeful assassins in the 1990s. programme.title: A Midsummer Night's Sex Comedy
programme.desc: Woody Allen's turn-of-the-century romp involving couples during a weekend in the country. Mia Farrow, Jose Ferrer, Julie Hagerty. Maxwell: Tony Roberts. Adrian: Mary Steenburgen. Gordon Willis photography. (cc).(n)

programme.title: The Broken
programme.desc: A woman is thrust into a world where everything is subtly unfamiliar in this thriller starring Lena Headey. Gina McVey is enjoying dinner with her family and her boyfriend Stefan when a mirror shatters without cause. The next day Gina sees a woman who looks like her own doppelganger. Curious, Gina sneaks into the woman's apartment and sees a photo of herself and her father. Later, Gina notices that Stefan is not the same and begins having horrific nightmares. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Volcano
programme.desc: Action flick about an emergency chief and a geologist who scramble to halt the destruction of L.A. from a volcanic eruption. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Clash of the Titans
programme.desc: In this fantasy adventure based on Greek mythology, a courageous warrior named Perseus vows to defeat Hades in order to prevent the god of the underworld from overthrowing Zeus, thereby turning Earth into a living hell. A man of godly origins, Perseus watched in agony as Hades took his family, but now, with a small band of warriors by his side, he battles mythical creatures while tapping into his god-like abilities to take control of his own fate. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Terminator Salvation
programme.desc: Set in the year 2018, John Connor leads the human resistance against the computer network Skynet as the machines grow more aggressive than ever before. John was raised to believe in a specific version of the future, but that future begins to shift with the appearance of mysterious former death-row inmate Marcus Wright. As John and Marcus venture into the mechanical heart of Skynet's operations, they make a terrifying discovery about the potential fate of the human race. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Funny People
programme.desc: A struggling stand-up comic befriends a movie star who's dealing with a serious illness and trying to win back the love of his life. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Arthur
programme.desc: Playboy man-child Arthur learns that his wealthy mother will only give him his inheritance if he agrees to marry the daughter of a millionaire. However, Arthur hates his intended bride and instead falls for an unlicensed tour guide. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Joneses
programme.desc: An ordinary suburban couple discover that their hospitable new neighbors are actually government spies. Soon, all four of them are caught up in an international espionage imbroglio. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Edge of Darkness
programme.desc: Boston cop Thomas Craven discovers his grown daughter Emma led a double life after she is shot to death on his doorstep. programme.desc: An arrogant baseball player leaves the game the moment he collects his 3000th hit, but, years later, when a statistical snafu is discovered and his total is lowered, the over-the-hill slugger must come out of retirement to reach the milestone and cement his place in baseball history. programme.desc: While the rest of the 9MAG crew is at a loss, Lily moves to bring the shop back from the dead. Ashley defies Don's demands and bails on Chicago for good. Ryan takes a stance with a new shop that pulls the rug out from under everyone. (repeat).

programme.title: Black Ink Crew: Chicago
programme.desc: Ryan starts a new shop but faces a learning curve when bringing in a new staff. Lily hires a new artist, which does not fly with Charmaine, who brought Dani back to the shop. Nikki throws Phor a surprise party that shows how much Chi-town loves him. (repeat).

programme.title: Black Ink Crew: Chicago
programme.desc: Charmaine makes a power grab for Loyal Ink, dividing the crew even further. Don faces huge repercussions after getting arrested for a DUI. Dani and Terrence's relationship continues to heat up. (repeat).

programme.title: Black Ink Crew: Chicago
programme.desc: Charmaine establishes the "rules" as she continues as H.B.I.C., causing Lily and Reese to rebel. Ryan reveals a long-awaited Mother's Day surprise for Rachel. And Van has a big blow-up with Jenn. (repeat).

programme.desc: The gang is concerned when a troubled Brianna receives a school suspension. Meanwhile, two aspiring fraternity members pull a prank on Brown, but not without consequences. And the boys' faculty adviser (Cameron Arnett) makes romantic moves on Cora. (repeat).

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Meet the Browns
programme.desc: Cora and Russell's romance continues to bloom, despite Brown's interference. Elsewhere, Brianna and Joaquin's onetime foster family agrees to adopt them, which upsets Sasha and Will. (repeat).

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Meet the Browns
programme.desc: Season 2 opens with Will and Sasha attempting to keep Brianna and Joaquin from being adopted. Elsewhere, Brown suspects that the neighborhood frat boys are growing pot, so he tries to smoke them out. (repeat).

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Meet the Browns
programme.desc: Brown decides to levy fees for amenities at the house, only to stir up an open rebellion when he begins to abuse the policy. Elsewhere, Sasha is a candidate for a job that pays more than Will's position. (repeat).

programme.title: Martin
programme.desc: Stan (Garrett Morris) wants to hire Gina (Tisha Campbell) to co-host Martin's show. Martin Lawrence. Cole: Carl Anthony Payne II. Tommy: Thomas Mikal Ford. (repeat).

programme.title: Martin
programme.desc: Martin gets some Christmas spirit---in the form of Past, Present and Future ghosts who teach him to love the holiday or else! Pam: Tichina Arnold. Gina: Tisha Campbell. Young Martin: Braden Williams. (repeat).

programme.title: Martin
programme.desc: Gina and Martin have a fight and break up. Part 1 of three. Richard Pryor guests. Martin Lawrence. Gina: Tisha Campbell. Pam: Tichina Arnold. Cole: Carl Anthony Payne II. (repeat).

programme.title: Martin
programme.desc: Gina is set up with Pam's cousin (David Alan Grier) while Martin meets another woman. Part 2 of three. Waiter: Eric Anderson. Woman No. 1: Kimberly Brooks. Woman No. 2: Mary Valena Broussard. (repeat).

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: A planned camping trip is cut short for Carlton and Will when a robber approaches them---and fires a gun. Vy: Vernee Watson-Johnson. Lisa: Nia Long. Nurse Avner: Beverly Jackson. Nurse Upton: Nita Whitaker. Will: Will Smith. (repeat).

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Vulnerable after getting shot, Will proposes to Lisa (Nia Long), who shoots him down with a rejection. Will: Will Smith. Hilary: Karyn Parsons. Therapist: Dominique Jennings. Vy: Vernee Watson-Johnson. Nurse: Lora Temple. (repeat).

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: In counseling, Will and Lisa hope to move on up to a new understanding in preparation for marriage. Sherman Hemsley and Isabel Sanford appear. Dr. Whitehorn: Don Lake. Lisa: Nia Long. (repeat).

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Will and Lisa's wedding plans get out of hand when Lisa's dad (John Amos) and Philip can't agree on the arrangements, so the couple heads for Las Vegas. Minister: Isaac Hayes. Samantha: Arnetia Walker-Francis. Angela: Cynthena Sanders. Lisa: Nia Long. (repeat).

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael decides his kids are spoiled and puts them to work. They must use their allowances as “seed money” for businesses. So Kady opens a lemonade stand and Claire opens a beauty salon (in the living room). And Jr.? He becomes a professional gambler. Meagan and Melissa Freeman, sisters of regular Jennifer Freeman (Claire), play Claire's friends Meagan and Melissa. John: Damon Wayans Jr. (repeat).

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Jay wants Michael to spend more quality time with her, while Michael wants to spend more quality time with his favorite video game. At first, Jay calls the situation “a breakdown in communication.” Then she ratchets it up to “You don't love me.” So it's off to a shrink. Meanwhile, Jr. has difficulty believing that other boys just might find Claire attractive. Dr. Madison: Kristin Wilson. Dr. Thomas: Jason Stuart. Waiter: Kevin Knotts. (repeat).

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael's cousin is getting married and Michael must rouse his reluctant family to get them all to the church on time. It won't be easy. The Kyles, he concedes, are “notoriously late” (except for him). Challenge No. 1: get Jay to decide which dress to wear. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: OG and her man discover they're not seeing eye to eye on marriage. Malaysia tries to keep her family from tearing itself apart. An explosive rumor threatens to destroy a friendship within the group. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Shaunie launches an investigation into a rumor that could blow up the group, and it results in more questions than answers. Jen continues to cover up her part. At a meeting of the Wives, Tami lashes out and says something she can't take back. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Tami lashes out at Evelyn, leaving the entire group taking cover and taking sides. As an escape, Evelyn puts together a charity event, but Shaunie refuses to welcome Jen. Malaysia tries to get CeCe and Kristen past their conflict. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Jackie stars in a play, but her nerves threaten to get the best of her. OG deals with the death of her brother, the loss ultimately brings her and an enemy close. The Wives come out to support Jackie's play, but there's just as much drama off-stage. (repeat).

programme.title: Love & Hip Hop Hollywood
programme.desc: K. Michelle returns to Hollywood, and she already has a score to settle with Lyrica. Moniece's bad behavior catches up to her. Scandal threatens Ray J's marriage to Princess. Teairra hits the town for the first time since rehab. (repeat).

programme.title: Waiting to Exhale
programme.desc: Four women gather regularly to share their friendship and to relate stories about their relationships with the men who breeze in and out and their lives.(n)

programme.title: The Wayans Bros.
programme.desc: A food fight breaks out when Uncle Nate parks his lunch truck across from Pops' diner, taking away his patrons. Nate: Antonio Fargas. Pops: John Witherspoon. Dee: Anna Maria Horsford. Shawn: Shawn Wayans. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: The Wayans Bros.
programme.desc: Dee flies off the handle when her sister thinks about giving up her Air Force career to be with Marlon (Marlon Wayans). Natalie: Devika Parikh. Dee: Anna Maria Horsford. Shawn: Shawn Wayans. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Meet the Browns
programme.desc: Cora lands a post as a substitute educator---but it's to teach the school's roughest, toughest pupils. And there's a passion for fashion when Brown and London square off in a fashion showdown. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Meet the Browns
programme.desc: Brianna and Joaquin's mother (Tasha Smith) tenaciously works to gain custody of the children upon her return from prison. Elsewhere, Brown unwittingly ingests the Colonel's male-enhancement pills. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Meet the Browns
programme.desc: Ms. Edna grows despondent in the wake of her friend's death, but it's a wonderful life when the gang stages a retrospective of her life to cheer her up. Elsewhere, Brown questions Jesus' sexual orientation. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Tyler Perry's Meet the Browns
programme.desc: Will plans to attend "career day" at Brianna's school, but Brown must replace him after an emergency sidelines Will. In other news, Brown decides he needs a fashion makeover. (repeat).(n)

programme.desc: Martin is charged with credit-card fraud and thrown in jail. Ricky: Reggie McFadden. Brother Shabazz: John Toles-Bey. Jeffrey: Billy Van Zandt. Sales Lady: Nancy Fish. Gina: Tisha Campbell. (repeat).(n)

programme.sub-title: Your Arms Are Too Short to Box with, Martin

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Will wows Philip with his sound investment advice to buy Jazz's apartment building---but the tenants later scream slumlord after Philip acts on Will's tip. Will: Will Smith. Carlton: Alfonso Ribeiro. Jazz: Jeffrey A. Townes. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Will inadvertently finds himself in the right place at the right time and lands a part in a soap opera. "Joan": Leann Hunley. "Royce": Keith Hamilton Cobb. Director: Cleto Augusto. "Jody": Jonathan Williams. "Derek": David Wasson. Lisa: Nia Long. Stage Manager: Beverly Jackson. Will: Will Smith. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.sub-title: Save the Last Trance for Me
programme.desc: Thanks to a hypnotist, Will acts like a 4-year-old during a family interview with the admissions head (Mark Roberts) of a private school for Nicky. The Great Mentos: Max Maven. Miss Jansen: Margaret Nagle. Penny: Caitlin Wachs. Will: Will Smith. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.sub-title: To Thine Own Self Be Blue...and Gold
programme.desc: A dream job for Will with a friend of Philip's turns into a nightmare when he's expected to bribe a councilman. Ernest: Charlie Robinson. Philip: James Avery. Will: Will Smith. Hilary: Karyn Parsons. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: The Kyles hit the road for an educational venture---they're going to Boston to visit Paul Revere's house. Trouble is, nobody but Jay wants to go (“Who cares where a dead rock star from the '60s was born?” moans Jr.). As it turns out, Jay's in a foul mood as well. Drive-Thru Attendant: Bill Macy. Police Officer No. 1: Johnny C. Pruitt. Police Officer No. 2: Patty Ross. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael (aka: Chief Bald Eagle) is recruited to camp out with Kady and her friends and teach them Native American lore. Meanwhile, Clare and “the new Tony” (Andrew McFarlane) plan to stay out all night themselves: they're plotting to sneak out to a “rave.” Rachel: Liliana Mumy. Charlotte: Gabby Soleil. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Michael, bemoaning the lack of quality time the Kyles spend with each other, decides to spend some time with the kids, whether they like it or not. Claire and Jr. don't, and Kady agrees only to watch the movie “The Little Mermaid” with him. Michael switches it with “Gremlins,” and that scares her. So does the power failure that soon follows (she thinks the two are related). But it least the blackout brings the Kyles together. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Jay nominates Michael for the “Small Businessman of the Year” award and he assumes he's going to win it (especially after a golfing buddy on the organization's board tells him: “If my vote were the only one that counted, you'd be a shoo-in”). Meanwhile, Claire helps herself to items from Jay's makeup bag once too often. (repeat).(n)

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia

programme.title: Dzień dobry
programme.desc: Poranne pasmo muzyczne, w którym prezentowane są najlepsze teledyski artystów cieszących się dużą popularnością.

programme.title: Eska On The Beach
programme.desc: Wakacyjny program Eski TV nadawany prosto z najpiękniejszych plaż. Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.

programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.(n)

programme.title: Eska On The Beach
programme.desc: Wakacyjny program Eski TV nadawany prosto z najpiękniejszych plaż. Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.(n)

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: The Boy in the Dress
programme.desc: Family comedy adapted from David Walliams' children's book about 12-year-old Dennis, an ordinary boy who lives in an ordinary town - but somehow feels different from everyone else. A chance sighting in a fashion magazine introduces him to a whole new world of colour and creativity. But can a boy really wear a dress - and what will his headmaster, dad and friends in the football team think if they find out? Billy Kennedy stars as Dennis, with a supporting cast including Jennifer Saunders, Tim McInnerny, Meera Syal, Steve Speirs, Felicity Montagu, James Buckley and Walliams himself, with a cameo appearance by supermodel Kate Moss.

Ollie is smuggled in to Lily's house by Martha to watch secretly from the attic, with Martha planning to split her time between both events. After much chaos and confusion, and with the presence of Ollie in the house rumbled, a compromise is finally reached, where the girls all get to do both the make-over and watch the rare comet. At the end of the make-over session Martha and Jas are horrified to see Lily has transformed herself to look exactly like Greta in a bid to impress Matt. To spare Lily's feelings they pretend to like her new look, but are relieved the next day in school to see Lily returned to her normal, natural self.
